DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Organ Brain Anatomic Site
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Named location with the central nervous system that received radiation therapy (RT).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions.  It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region.  Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus._Named locations of or within the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions.  It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region.  Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.

Property.preferredDefinition: Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: Named locations of or within the body.

Property.changeDescription: Updated to point to NCI Thesaurus concept code.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Named locations of or within the body.

PermissibleValues.value: Spinal Cord, Cranial Nerves, Other Parts of the CNS
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Spinal Cord, Cranial Nerves and Other Central Nervous System

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Spinal Cord, Cranial Nerves and Other Central Nervous System
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The elongated, approximately cylindrical part of the central nervous system of vertebrates that lies in the vertebral canal and from which the spinal nerves emerge.: Any of the 12 paired nerves that originate in the brain stem.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

Concepts.definition: The elongated, approximately cylindrical part of the central nervous system of vertebrates that lies in the vertebral canal and from which the spinal nerves emerge.
Any of the 12 paired nerves that originate in the brain stem.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

Concepts.definition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: Named locations of or within the body.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support NCI CCR study of brain cancer BTTC11, a study being run also at MD Anderson, so the lists of values and semantics are created exactly to support that trial. 11.13.2015. dmr.
